snippet: Trinity Church is the largest landlord in Hudson Square and is part of the effort to rezone the area to residential from manufacturing.
abstract: Construction begins on a $113 million renovation of 330 Hudson Street in the Hudson Square neighborhood of New York City; the project includes adding eight stories to the circa 1910 building to create a 440,000-square-foot office tower; Trinity Church, the area's largest landlord, has spent decades transforming it from a manufacturing center to a technology and media hub.
lead_paragraph: Trinity Church is the largest landlord in Hudson Square and is part of the effort to rezone the area to residential from manufacturing.

headline.seo: Trinity Church Leads Transformation of Manhattan’s Hudson Square
headline.main: Manhattan Church Leads an Area’s Improvement
headline.print_headline: Manhattan Church Leads an Area’s Improvement
